README.html.title: ASE semester 1 2025 Portfolio | MyBOOSE_Documentation
README.html.summary: ASE semester 1 2025 Portfolio Basic Object Orientated Software Engineering (BOOSE). Fill in the fields below. Malaeka Shahbaz Group 3 Each element is covered in the weekly sessions, using the BOOSE library source code as an example. I will discuss how I implemented the more difficult elements (like the parser, implementing loops etc.) Keep your progress up to date below. Put "DONE" after each section, when you have done it. The number in brackets represents the component that each element contributes to. Checkpoint 1 Version Control (1) At least two documented commits to provided on GitHub Classroom BEFORE 12pm 7th October. Done At least 5 documented commits. Done Readme.md file filled in correctly. Done 2 Unit Tests for basic drawing commands above (1) Unit Test for moveto command (variables storing pen position are correct). Done Unit Test for drawTo command (variables storing pen position are correct). Done Unit Test for a multiline program. Done 3 XML Comments/documentation produced (1) Fully documented with XML comments and Documentation web site produced. Done 4 Exception Handling (1) 5 Library (DLL) installed and working with reasonable user interface (2) Form interface with program window, output window and run button. Done BOOSE DLL library installed. Done call about method and display returned information in output/debug window. Done you can use System.Diagnostics to output to the debug window. Done 6 Basic drawing commands of the library are implemented (2) Moveto, circle, rect, pencolour, write. Done Unrestricted drawing programs can be run (1unrestrictedDrawing.boose). Done You MUST fill in the this form before submission and submit your zipped up project to myBeckett Read the hand in instructions on myBeckett carefully to ensure you are submitting everything correctly, as if you don't you may be subject to a penalty. Final Submission 1 Further Version Control (1) DONE You must continue to use VC to a professional standard with frequent and clear commits Your Readme.md must be up to date 2 Use of Interfaces (1) DONE Interfaces to be used for all classes where appropriate 3 Further Unit Testing (1) DONE Tests for full program all of the facilities completed in 5,6 and 7 below It is up to you how design your tests (i.e. one test per facility or one test testing many but they must be clearly documented with XML comments) 4 Design Patterns (1) DONE Use of factory Design Pattern for command creation Use of Singleton Design Pattern Demonstrate the use of another design pattern of your choice (for 5,6 and 7 you can click the links to see the example BOOSE programs that must be run, these are in your Portfolio. You must run the unrestricted programs and replace the image already there with an image of your BOOSE Interpreter running the BOOSE programs. You may show further programs in your portfolio.) 5 Replaced variables (2) * DONE Int Real Array 6 Replaced if, while, for (2) * DONE While For If else 7 Replaced Methods (2) * DONE 8 Additional (web version, text-based version, extension to BOOSE itself, etc, discuss with your tutor) (2) * You must rewrite the functionality and not try and "hack the system". I've tried to make it so you can't but who knows, either way, you've been told. You MUST fill in this form whilst recording your YouTube Video AND submit it to myBeckett Read the hand in instructions on myBeckett carefully to ensure you are submitting everything correctly, as if you don't you may be subject to a penalty. Links These are for convinience. Check on myBeckett in the Assessment directory for any up to date links. BOOSE Documentation BOOSE DLL Download Assignment Specification - including all university details Detailed Assignment Information - with marking scheme Assignment Help Videos Remember that BOOSE.DLL maybe updated, as it may have bugs in it, or new features may be added. Keep updated on Discord and make sure you always have the latest version in your project. V1.0

api/BooseApp.AppBool.html.title: Class AppBool | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.AppBool.html.summary: Class AppBool Namespace BooseApp Assembly BooseApp.dll public class AppBool : IInterpreter Inheritance object AppBool Implements IInterpreter Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppBool(ICanvas) Initializes a new instance of AppBool. public AppBool(ICanvas canvas) Parameters canvas ICanvas Canvas used for output; must not be null. Exceptions ArgumentNullException canvas is null. Methods Run(string) Execute a multi-line boolean program. public void Run(string program) Parameters program string Program text. Lines are split by LF and trimmed. null is ignored. Remarks Each non-empty, non-comment line is processed by ProcessLine(string). Comment lines start with // or *.

api/BooseApp.AppCommandFactory.html.title: Class AppCommandFactory | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.AppCommandFactory.html.summary: Class AppCommandFactory Namespace BooseApp Assembly BooseApp.dll factory that creates application specific BOOSE.ICommand instances. returns the restricted command implimentations for commands the application overrides. for e.g. circle, rect, moveto, and delegates to the base BOOSE.CommandFactory for any other command names. public class AppCommandFactory : CommandFactory, ICommandFactory Inheritance object CommandFactory AppCommandFactory Implements ICommandFactory Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods MakeCommand(string) Creates an BOOSE.ICommand for the specified command keyword. public override ICommand MakeCommand(string commandType) Parameters commandType string the command keyword expected lower case , e.g. circle, rect, moveto. Returns ICommand a new BOOSE.ICommand instance appropriate for commandType. Returns application specific command class Circle Rectangle. MoveTo when the command is handled by the application, else, it returns the result from the base BOOSE.CommandFactory implimentation. See Also CommandFactory

api/BooseApp.AppFor.html.title: Class AppFor | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.AppFor.html.summary: Class AppFor Namespace BooseApp Assembly BooseApp.dll Interpreter that supports integer variables, assignments and structured for/end for loops, plus basic drawing commands: pen, moveto, circle, rect. public class AppFor : IInterpreter Inheritance object AppFor Implements IInterpreter Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks For header syntax: for <var> = <start> to <end> [step <stepExpr>] Example: for count = 1 to 20 step 2 circle count * 10 end for Implements IInterpreter. Constructors AppFor(ICanvas) Initializes a new instance of AppFor. public AppFor(ICanvas canvas) Parameters canvas ICanvas Canvas instance used for drawing; must not be null. Exceptions ArgumentNullException canvas is null. Methods Run(string) Execute a multi-line program. public void Run(string program) Parameters program string Program text. Lines are normalized to LF and split. Null is ignored. Remarks Each non-empty, non-comment (// or *) line is processed by ExecuteBlock(string[], int, int).

api/BooseApp.AppInt.html.title: Class AppInt | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.AppInt.html.summary: Class AppInt Namespace BooseApp Assembly BooseApp.dll Minimal interpreter for the small BOOSE-like script shown by the user. public class AppInt : IInterpreter Inheritance object AppInt Implements IInterpreter Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks Supports: variable declarations/assignments (int), basic expressions (+, -, *, /, parentheses), commands: pen r,g,b, moveto x,y, circle radius, rect width,height. Variable names may be used as arguments (e.g. circle radius). This class is intentionally small and deterministic for UI tests. Constructors AppInt(ICanvas) Initializes a new instance of AppInt. public AppInt(ICanvas canvas) Parameters canvas ICanvas Canvas used for drawing; must not be null. Exceptions ArgumentNullException canvas is null. Methods Run(string) Execute a multi-line program. public void Run(string program) Parameters program string Program text. Lines are normalized to LF and split. Null is ignored. Remarks Each non-empty, non-comment line is processed by ProcessLine(string). Comments start with // or *.

api/BooseApp.AppMethods.html.title: Class AppMethods | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.AppMethods.html.summary: Class AppMethods Namespace BooseApp Assembly BooseApp.dll Interpreter extended with simple method definitions and calls. Supports method declaration form: method int Name int p1, int p2 Name = <expression> end method and invocation: call Name arg1 arg2 The call evaluates the method body in a local scope and stores the result in a global variable named after the method so subsequent "write Name" or other expressions can reference it. Implementation reuses most of the AppFor language features (loops, expressions, commands). public class AppMethods : IInterpreter Inheritance object AppMethods Implements IInterpreter Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppMethods(ICanvas) Initializes a new instance of AppMethods. public AppMethods(ICanvas canvas) Parameters canvas ICanvas Canvas used to draw output and text; must not be null. Exceptions ArgumentNullException canvas is null. Methods Run(string) Execute a multi-line program containing method definitions, calls and simple statements. public void Run(string program) Parameters program string Program text. Null is ignored. Lines are split on LF.

api/BooseApp.AppReal.html.title: Class AppReal | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.AppReal.html.summary: Class AppReal Namespace BooseApp Assembly BooseApp.dll Simple real-number interpreter for a small BOOSE-like script. public class AppReal : IInterpreter Inheritance object AppReal Implements IInterpreter Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks Supports: real variable declarations/assignments (e.g. real pi = 3.14), arithmetic with + - * / and parentheses, commands: pen r,g,b, moveto x,y, circle radius, write expr. Variables and numeric literals are parsed as double. Constructors AppReal(ICanvas) Initializes a new instance of AppReal. public AppReal(ICanvas canvas) Parameters canvas ICanvas Canvas used for drawing and text output. Must not be null. Exceptions ArgumentNullException canvas is null. Methods Run(string) Execute a multi-line program. public void Run(string program) Parameters program string Program text. Lines are normalized to LF and split. Null is ignored. Remarks Each non-empty, non-comment line is passed to ProcessLine(string). Comments start with // or *.

api/BooseApp.AppWhile.html.title: Class AppWhile | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.AppWhile.html.summary: Class AppWhile Namespace BooseApp Assembly BooseApp.dll Interpreter that supports integer variables, assignments and structured while/end while loops, plus basic drawing commands: pen, moveto, circle, rect and nested if/else/end if inside blocks. Implements IInterpreter. public class AppWhile : IInterpreter Inheritance object AppWhile Implements IInterpreter Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppWhile(ICanvas) Initializes a new instance of AppWhile. public AppWhile(ICanvas canvas) Parameters canvas ICanvas Canvas used for drawing; must not be null. Exceptions ArgumentNullException canvas is null. Methods Run(string) Execute the supplied program text. public void Run(string program) Parameters program string Program text. Lines are normalized to LF and split. Null is ignored. Remarks The interpreter executes the script as a top-level block to support nested control structures (while, if/else). Comment lines start with // or *.

api/BooseApp.Applfs.html.title: Class Applfs | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.Applfs.html.summary: Class Applfs Namespace BooseApp Assembly BooseApp.dll public class Applfs : IInterpreter Inheritance object Applfs Implements IInterpreter Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors Applfs(ICanvas) Initializes a new instance of Applfs. public Applfs(ICanvas canvas) Parameters canvas ICanvas Canvas used for drawing; must not be null. Exceptions ArgumentNullException canvas is null. Methods Run(string) Execute the supplied program text. public void Run(string program) Parameters program string Program text. Lines are normalized to LF and split. Comments start with // or *. Remarks The method maintains an execution stack to support nested if/else branches; only statements inside an active branch are executed. Recognised commands inside active branches: int declarations, assignments, and drawing commands. Exceptions InvalidOperationException Thrown when block terminators are mismatched.

api/BooseApp.Array.html.title: Class Array | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.Array.html.summary: Class Array Namespace BooseApp Assembly BooseApp.dll Minimal interpreter that supports: int and real variable declarations array declarations: "array int name size" / "array real name size" poke: "poke arr index = expr" (assign into array) peek: "peek var = arr index" (read from array into variable) pen, moveto, circle, write This class is intentionally small and deterministic for UI use. public class Array : IInterpreter Inheritance object Array Implements IInterpreter Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors Array(ICanvas) Initializes a new instance of the Array interpreter. public Array(ICanvas canvas) Parameters canvas ICanvas Canvas to draw on; must not be null. Exceptions ArgumentNullException canvas is null. Methods Run(string) Execute the supplied program text. public void Run(string program) Parameters program string Program text to execute. Lines are commonly normalized to LF before processing. Implementations should document how they treat null, comments and line endings.

api/BooseApp.CanvasSingleton.html.title: Class CanvasSingleton | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.CanvasSingleton.html.summary: Class CanvasSingleton Namespace BooseApp Assembly BooseApp.dll Provides a single shared BOOSE.ICanvas instance for the application. public sealed class CanvasSingleton Inheritance object CanvasSingleton Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks The singleton is implemented with Lazy<T> for safe, lazy, thread-safe initialization. The concrete canvas instance created is an IAppCanvas with a default size of 1178x719. Consumers should access the canvas via the static Instance property. Properties Instance Gets the application's shared BOOSE.ICanvas instance. public static ICanvas Instance { get; } Property Value ICanvas The singleton BOOSE.ICanvas. Remarks The instance is created on first access in a thread-safe manner by the Lazy<ICanvas>.

api/BooseApp.Circle.html.title: Class Circle | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.Circle.html.summary: Class Circle Namespace BooseApp Assembly BooseApp.dll Command that draws an outlined circle on the application's canvas. public class Circle : CommandOneParameter, ICommand Inheritance object Command CanvasCommand CommandOneParameter Circle Implements ICommand Inherited Members CommandOneParameter.param1 CommandOneParameter.param1unprocessed CommandOneParameter.CheckParameters(string[]) CanvasCommand.yPos CanvasCommand.xPos CanvasCommand.canvas CanvasCommand.Canvas Command.IsDouble Command.program Command.parameterList Command.parameters Command.paramsint Command.Set(StoredProgram, string) Command.Compile() Command.ProcessParameters(string) Command.ToString() Command.Program Command.Name Command.ParameterList Command.Parameters Command.Paramsint object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Remarks Circle derives from BOOSE.CommandOneParameter, so it expects a single integer parameter: the circle radius. The command integrates with the BOOSE parser/command factory and uses the base class to parse and validate parameters before execution. Constructors Circle() Initializes a new instance of the Circle command. public Circle() Remarks This default constructor is used by the command factory when the command is created without pre-specified parameters. Parameter parsing occurs in Execute(). Circle(Canvas, int) Initializes a new instance of the Circle command with a canvas and radius. public Circle(Canvas c, int radius) Parameters c Canvas Canvas instance used to draw the circle. radius int Initial radius for the command. Methods Execute() Executes the circle command. public override void Execute() Remarks Invokes CommandOneParameter.Execute to ensure parameters are parsed. Rejects double (floating-point) parameters (the interpreter surface for this command is integer-only) by throwing a BOOSE.CanvasException. Reads the radius from the parsed integer parameter collection (Paramsint[0]). Validates that the radius is positive and draws an outlined circle via Circle(int, bool) (filled flag: false). Exceptions CanvasException Thrown when the command receives a double parameter or when the radius is less than 1. The message is intended to be user-facing and displayed by the UI's error log.

object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Remarks The form creates a shared BOOSE.ICanvas (via CanvasSingleton), provides an AppCommandFactory to the parser and shows concise user-facing error messages in the error log textbox. Constructors Form1() Initializes a new instance of the Form1 class. Creates canvas and parser/factory instances and writes BOOSE about info to debug output. public Form1() Fields Factory Application command factory used by the parser. public CommandFactory Factory Field Value CommandFactory Program StoredProgram instance used by the parser/command system. public StoredProgram Program Field Value StoredProgram myCanvas Shared canvas used by interpreters and commands. public ICanvas myCanvas Field Value ICanvas Properties UserInput Gets or sets the program text displayed in the main input textbox. public string UserInput { get; set; } Property Value string Methods Dispose(bool) Clean up any resources being used. protected override void Dispose(bool disposing) Parameters disposing bool true when called from user code to release both managed and unmaneged resources; false when called from a finalizer to release only unmanaged resources.

api/BooseApp.IAppCanvas.html.title: Class IAppCanvas | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.IAppCanvas.html.summary: Class IAppCanvas Namespace BooseApp Assembly BooseApp.dll simple bitmap canvas implimentation of ICanvas from BOOSE Provides basic drawning methods like moveto, drawto, circle, rect, tri, writetext. public class IAppCanvas : ICanvas Inheritance object IAppCanvas Implements ICanvas Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors IAppCanvas(int, int) initializes a new instance of the IAppCanvas class. public IAppCanvas(int xsize, int ysize) Parameters xsize int The width of the bitmap in pixels. ysize int The height of the bitmap in pixels. Properties PenColour Gets or sets the current pen colour. Accepts a Color or an ARGB integer. public object PenColour { get; set; } Property Value object the pen colour. Xpos gets or sets the xpos. public int Xpos { get; set; } Property Value int The Xpos. Ypos get or sets the ypos. public int Ypos { get; set; } Property Value int the Ypos. Methods Circle(int, bool) Draws Circle with the specified radius. public void Circle(int radius, bool filled) Parameters radius int Radius in pixel has to be bigger than or equal to 1 filled bool if set to true [filled], else it just draws the outline. Clear() clears the canvas and textbox. public void Clear() DrawTo(int, int) draws from one point to another.Provides the x and y cordinates ton draw. public void DrawTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int Target X coordinate. y int Target Y coordinate. Exceptions NotImplementedException MoveTo(int, int) moves the pen point to the specified coordinates without drawing. public void MoveTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int Provide X coordinate. y int Provide Y coordinate. Rect(int, int, bool) Draws Rectangle at the current pen position with the specified width and height. public void Rect(int width, int height, bool filled) Parameters width int the width is measured in pixels, must be bigger than or equal to 1. height int the height is measures in pixels,must be bigger than or equal to 1. filled bool tif set to true [filled], else, draws only the outline. Reset() resets the pen position, colour & width to defaults and clears the canvas. public void Reset() Set(int, int) sets the specified width. public void Set(int width, int height) Parameters width int the width. height int the height. SetColour(int, int, int) sets the colour. public void SetColour(int red, int green, int blue) Parameters red int the red. green int the green. blue int the blue. Tri(int, int) Draws the triangle using the pen position as the top vertex. public void Tri(int width, int height) Parameters width int height int Exceptions NotImplementedException WriteText(string) It draws the text at the current pen position using default font. public void WriteText(string text) Parameters text string text to draw. getBitmap() gets the bitmap used for rendering. public object getBitmap() Returns object See Also ICanvas

api/BooseApp.IInterpreter.html.title: Interface IInterpreter | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.IInterpreter.html.summary: Interface IInterpreter Namespace BooseApp Assembly BooseApp.dll Defines a simple interpreter contract for executing BOOSE-style program text. public interface IInterpreter Remarks Implementations execute the provided program text when Run(string) is called. Typical interpreters normalize line endings and split on LF; implementations decide how to handle null/empty input, comments and error reporting. Implementations are free to maintain internal state (variables, stacks, etc.) or be stateless as required by the specific language variant. Methods Run(string) Execute the supplied program text. void Run(string program) Parameters program string Program text to execute. Lines are commonly normalized to LF before processing. Implementations should document how they treat null, comments and line endings.

api/BooseApp.MoveTo.html.title: Class MoveTo | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.MoveTo.html.summary: Class MoveTo Namespace BooseApp Assembly BooseApp.dll command that moves the current pen position to the specific coordinates on the canvas. public class MoveTo : CommandTwoParameters, ICommand Inheritance object Command CanvasCommand CommandOneParameter CommandTwoParameters MoveTo Implements ICommand Inherited Members CommandTwoParameters.param2 CommandTwoParameters.param2unprocessed CommandTwoParameters.CheckParameters(string[]) CommandOneParameter.param1 CommandOneParameter.param1unprocessed CanvasCommand.yPos CanvasCommand.xPos CanvasCommand.canvas CanvasCommand.Canvas Command.IsDouble Command.program Command.parameterList Command.parameters Command.paramsint Command.Set(StoredProgram, string) Command.Compile() Command.ProcessParameters(string) Command.ToString() Command.Program Command.Name Command.ParameterList Command.Parameters Command.Paramsint object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Remarks this class derives from CommandTwoParameters and expects two integer parameters: the X and Y coordinates. The command validates the parameter types and ranges and throws user facing BOOSE.CanvasException messages for invalid input. Constructors MoveTo() initializes a new instance of the MoveTo class used by the command factory when creating a command with no returns parameters. public MoveTo() MoveTo(Canvas, int, int) Initializes a new instance of the MoveTo class with a canvas and coordinates. public MoveTo(Canvas c, int x, int y) Parameters c Canvas Canvas instance to operate on. x int Initial X coordinate for the command. y int Initial Y coordinate for the command. Methods Execute() executes the moveto command public override void Execute() Remarks The method: invokes the base execution to ensure parameters are parsed. rejects the double parameters (floating point) with a BOOSE.CanvasException. reads the integer parameters from the base Paramsint collection. validates that coordinates must be 0 or more and moves the canvas pen position via MoveTo(int, int) Exceptions CanvasException Thrown when the command was supplied double parameters or when coordinates are negative. the exception message is intended to to be user facing and displayed in the application's error log See Also CommandTwoParameters

api/BooseApp.Rectangle.html.title: Class Rectangle | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.Rectangle.html.summary: Class Rectangle Namespace BooseApp Assembly BooseApp.dll Command that draws the Rectangle on the BOOSE.Canvas validates two integer parameters (width, height) and throws user facing BOOSE.CanvasException for invalid input. public class Rectangle : CommandTwoParameters, ICommand Inheritance object Command CanvasCommand CommandOneParameter CommandTwoParameters Rectangle Implements ICommand Inherited Members CommandTwoParameters.param2 CommandTwoParameters.param2unprocessed CommandTwoParameters.CheckParameters(string[]) CommandOneParameter.param1 CommandOneParameter.param1unprocessed CanvasCommand.yPos CanvasCommand.xPos CanvasCommand.canvas CanvasCommand.Canvas Command.IsDouble Command.program Command.parameterList Command.parameters Command.paramsint Command.Set(StoredProgram, string) Command.Compile() Command.ProcessParameters(string) Command.ToString() Command.Program Command.Name Command.ParameterList Command.Parameters Command.Paramsint object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Remarks this class derives from BOOSE.CommandTwoParameters and is intended to be created by AppCommandFactory when the parser encounters the "rect" command. Constructors Rectangle() initializes a new instance of the Rectangle class. its used by the factory when creating a command instance with no runtime parameters. public Rectangle() Rectangle(Canvas, int, int) initializes a new instance of the Rectangle class with a canvas size. public Rectangle(Canvas c, int width, int height) Parameters c Canvas canvas instance is used to draw the rectangle. width int initial rectangle width in pixels. height int initial rectangle height in pixels. Methods Execute() execute the rect command: validate parameters and draw an unfilled rectangle. using Rect(int, int, bool) public override void Execute() Exceptions CanvasException thrown when the command is supplied double parameters or when the width/height are not bigger than zero. Messages are intended to be user friendly and displayed in the application's error log.

api/BooseApp.Tests.AppBoolTests.html.title: Class AppBoolTests | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.Tests.AppBoolTests.html.summary: Class AppBoolTests Namespace BooseApp.Tests Assembly BOOSE_Test.dll Unit tests for the AppBool interpreter, verifying boolean write behavior and that subsequent commands (like moveto) update the canvas as expected. [TestClass] public class AppBoolTests Inheritance object AppBoolTests Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods WriteBoolean_AndMoveto() Verifies that a boolean value can be written by the interpreter and that a following moveto command updates the canvas coordinates. [TestMethod] public void WriteBoolean_AndMoveto()

api/BooseApp.Tests.AppForTests.html.title: Class AppForTests | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.Tests.AppForTests.html.summary: Class AppForTests Namespace BooseApp.Tests Assembly BOOSE_Test.dll Unit tests for the AppFor interpreter, verifying behavior of for-loops and effects on the canvas state. [TestClass] public class AppForTests Inheritance object AppForTests Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods ForLoop_ExecutesLastMoveto() Verifies that a for loop executes its body the correct number of times and that the final moveto command reflects the last iteration's coordinates. [TestMethod] public void ForLoop_ExecutesLastMoveto()

api/BooseApp.Tests.AppMethodsTests.html.title: Class AppMethodsTests | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.Tests.AppMethodsTests.html.summary: Class AppMethodsTests Namespace BooseApp.Tests Assembly BOOSE_Test.dll Tests for method declaration, autocorrection and invocation behavior in the AppMethods interpreter. [TestClass] public class AppMethodsTests Inheritance object AppMethodsTests Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods CallMethod_AutoCorrectsAndRuns() Verifies that a method declared as mulMethod can be called using a misspelled name (mullMethod), that autocorrection runs the method, and that subsequent commands such as moveto execute without error. [TestMethod] public void CallMethod_AutoCorrectsAndRuns()

api/BooseApp.Tests.AppWhileTests.html.title: Class AppWhileTests | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.Tests.AppWhileTests.html.summary: Class AppWhileTests Namespace BooseApp.Tests Assembly BOOSE_Test.dll Unit tests for the AppWhile interpreter, verifying that while-loops execute their body and update the canvas state as expected. [TestClass] public class AppWhileTests Inheritance object AppWhileTests Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods WhileLoop_ExecutesBody() Verifies that a while loop executes its body the correct number of times. The test runs a small program that increments a counter and moves the pen; the final moveto should reflect the last iteration's coordinates. [TestMethod] public void WhileLoop_ExecutesBody()

api/BooseApp.Tests.ArrayTests.html.title: Class ArrayTests | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.Tests.ArrayTests.html.summary: Class ArrayTests Namespace BooseApp.Tests Assembly BOOSE_Test.dll Unit tests covering array operations and the moveto command for the Array interpreter. [TestClass] public class ArrayTests Inheritance object ArrayTests Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods PokePeek_AndMoveto() Verifies that poke and peek work and that the moveto command updates the canvas coordinates as expected. [TestMethod] public void PokePeek_AndMoveto()

api/BooseApp.Tests.IAppCanvasTests.html.title: Class IAppCanvasTests | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.Tests.IAppCanvasTests.html.summary: Class IAppCanvasTests Namespace BooseApp.Tests Assembly BOOSE_Test.dll Contains unit tests for the IAppCanvas class. These tests validate canvas position updates, drawing behaviors, and state consistency. [TestClass] public class IAppCanvasTests Inheritance object IAppCanvasTests Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods DrawTo_Updates_Xpos_And_Ypos_EvenIfMethodThrows() Verifies that calling DrawTo(int, int) updates the Xpos and Ypos properties even if the method throws an exception (such as NotImplementedException). [TestMethod] public void DrawTo_Updates_Xpos_And_Ypos_EvenIfMethodThrows() MoveTo_Updates_Xpos_And_Ypos() Tests that calling MoveTo(int, int) correctly updates the Xpos and Ypos properties. [TestMethod] public void MoveTo_Updates_Xpos_And_Ypos() MultilineProgram_Sequence_Produces_Expected_FinalState() Simulates a multi-line drawing sequence to verify that a series of drawing commands produce the expected final state of the IAppCanvas. [TestMethod] public void MultilineProgram_Sequence_Produces_Expected_FinalState() Remarks This test acts as an integration-style test by sequentially invoking multiple IAppCanvas methods, similar to executing a simple Boose program.

api/BooseApp.Tests.Interpreters_Tests.ht.title: Class Interpreters_Tests | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.Tests.Interpreters_Tests.ht.summary: Class Interpreters_Tests Namespace BooseApp.Tests Assembly BOOSE_Test.dll Collection of integration-style unit tests that exercise the various interpreter implementations provided by the BooseApp project. [TestClass] public class Interpreters_Tests Inheritance object Interpreters_Tests Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Remarks Each test creates an IAppCanvas and a specific interpreter, runs a small program snippet and asserts the canvas final state (pen position, colour, etc.) or that commands execute without throwing. These tests validate interoperability between the interpreters and the application canvas implementation. Methods AppBool_Write_AndMoveto() Verifies that the boolean interpreter (AppBool) can write a boolean value and that subsequent drawing commands (like moveto) still execute. [TestMethod] public void AppBool_Write_AndMoveto() AppCommandFactory_Returns_AppCommands() Verifies that the application command factory (AppCommandFactory) returns concrete command implementations for common command names. [TestMethod] public void AppCommandFactory_Returns_AppCommands() AppFor_Loop_ExecutesLastMoveto() Verifies that the AppFor interpreter executes a for loop and that the final moveto reflects the last iteration. [TestMethod] public void AppFor_Loop_ExecutesLastMoveto() AppInt_MovetoAndPen_UpdatesCanvas() Verifies that the integer interpreter (AppInt) correctly processes moveto and pen commands and updates the canvas position and pen colour. [TestMethod] public void AppInt_MovetoAndPen_UpdatesCanvas() AppMethods_CallAndWrite_NoExceptionAndMovetoWorks() Verifies that method definitions and calls via AppMethods execute without exception (including minor name autocorrection) and that subsequent commands run. [TestMethod] public void AppMethods_CallAndWrite_NoExceptionAndMovetoWorks() AppReal_Moveto_RoundsCoordinates() Verifies that the real-number interpreter (AppReal) rounds coordinates when executing a moveto with fractional values. [TestMethod] public void AppReal_Moveto_RoundsCoordinates() AppWhile_Loop_ExecutesBody() Verifies that the AppWhile interpreter executes the body of a while loop the correct number of times and updates the canvas accordingly. [TestMethod] public void AppWhile_Loop_ExecutesBody() Array_PokePeek_NoExceptionAndMoveto() Verifies array, poke and peek operations in the Array interpreter and that a following moveto updates the canvas. [TestMethod] public void Array_PokePeek_NoExceptionAndMoveto()

api/BooseApp.Tests.html.title: Namespace BooseApp.Tests | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.Tests.html.summary: Namespace BooseApp.Tests Classes AppBoolTests Unit tests for the AppBool interpreter, verifying boolean write behavior and that subsequent commands (like moveto) update the canvas as expected. AppForTests Unit tests for the AppFor interpreter, verifying behavior of for-loops and effects on the canvas state. AppMethodsTests Tests for method declaration, autocorrection and invocation behavior in the AppMethods interpreter. AppWhileTests Unit tests for the AppWhile interpreter, verifying that while-loops execute their body and update the canvas state as expected. ArrayTests Unit tests covering array operations and the moveto command for the Array interpreter. IAppCanvasTests Contains unit tests for the IAppCanvas class. These tests validate canvas position updates, drawing behaviors, and state consistency. Interpreters_Tests Collection of integration-style unit tests that exercise the various interpreter implementations provided by the BooseApp project.

api/BooseApp.html.title: Namespace BooseApp | MyBOOSE_Documentation
api/BooseApp.html.summary: Namespace BooseApp Classes AppBool AppCommandFactory factory that creates application specific BOOSE.ICommand instances. returns the restricted command implimentations for commands the application overrides. for e.g. circle, rect, moveto, and delegates to the base BOOSE.CommandFactory for any other command names. AppFor Interpreter that supports integer variables, assignments and structured for/end for loops, plus basic drawing commands: pen, moveto, circle, rect. AppInt Minimal interpreter for the small BOOSE-like script shown by the user. AppMethods Interpreter extended with simple method definitions and calls. Supports method declaration form: method int Name int p1, int p2 Name = <expression> end method and invocation: call Name arg1 arg2 The call evaluates the method body in a local scope and stores the result in a global variable named after the method so subsequent "write Name" or other expressions can reference it. Implementation reuses most of the AppFor language features (loops, expressions, commands). AppReal Simple real-number interpreter for a small BOOSE-like script. AppWhile Interpreter that supports integer variables, assignments and structured while/end while loops, plus basic drawing commands: pen, moveto, circle, rect and nested if/else/end if inside blocks. Implements IInterpreter. Applfs Array Minimal interpreter that supports: int and real variable declarations array declarations: "array int name size" / "array real name size" poke: "poke arr index = expr" (assign into array) peek: "peek var = arr index" (read from array into variable) pen, moveto, circle, write This class is intentionally small and deterministic for UI use. CanvasSingleton Provides a single shared BOOSE.ICanvas instance for the application. Circle Command that draws an outlined circle on the application's canvas. Form1 Main application form for the BOOSE interpreter UI. Hosts the program input textbox, a Run button, an error log and a picture box that displays the drawing canvas. IAppCanvas simple bitmap canvas implimentation of ICanvas from BOOSE Provides basic drawning methods like moveto, drawto, circle, rect, tri, writetext. MoveTo command that moves the current pen position to the specific coordinates on the canvas. Rectangle Command that draws the Rectangle on the BOOSE.Canvas validates two integer parameters (width, height) and throws user facing BOOSE.CanvasException for invalid input. Interfaces IInterpreter Defines a simple interpreter contract for executing BOOSE-style program text.
